definition: good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: Yes, kindness is a habit. And it can be cultivated.
sentences.chinese: 是的，善心也是一种习惯，可以培养。

sentences.english: Please don't go, I entreat you.
sentences.chinese: 女神，我请求你发发善心。

sentences.english: He is actuated not by kindness but by a desire for fame.
sentences.chinese: 是求名之心而非善心促使他这么做。

sentences.english: I know there is some charitable soul out there who can save my daughter.
sentences.chinese: 我知道有很多有善心的人可能会帮到我的女儿。
女神，我请求你发发善心。

sentences.english: Don't expect him to show kindness to you.
sentences.chinese: 别指望他会对你发善心。

sentences.english: Once upon a time there lived in a country a do-gooder.
sentences.chinese: 从前，在一个国家里，有一位做了无数善事的善心者。

sentences.english: The devil is good when he is pleased.
I'm sure you cannot help being good-hearted .
sentences.chinese: 我想你是不由自主地发善心。

sentences.english: His benevolence made it possible for many poor children to attend college.
sentences.chinese: 他的善心使得许多穷孩子上大学成为可能。

sentences.english: You depend on the kindness of strangers.
Rich gifts wax poor when givers prove unkind.
sentences.chinese: 施者证实无善心，富裕的礼品只修饰穷人。

sentences.english: It is easy to be kind. She will be supremely happy.
sentences.chinese: 发善心是容易的，丽齐准会高兴得发狂。

definition: to do good works/to be merciful
to accumulate merit/to do good/to give to charity/virtuous actions
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
